applicant_types: Registered charities; Voluntary organisations; Community groups
geographic_scope: Essex (with rare exceptions for support outside the county or to specific charities if required)
beneficiary_focus: People in Essex; Vulnerable people; Children; Young people; Elderly; People with disabilities; People with health needs; Community groups
funding_range: Not stated (examples: £7,250 - £8,565; grants typically in the £1,000 - £10,000 range)
restrictions: Most funds restricted to Essex beneficiaries; Some funds have specific aims or restrictions; Some district/area-specific funds (e.g., Southend, Bradwell, Harwich); Rare support outside Essex or to specific charities if required
notes: ECF manages over 200 funds, most for Essex causes. Some funds may support charities outside Essex or with specific links, but this is rare and usually at donor request. No explicit exclusion of hospices or palliative care, but Kent-based applicants are not routinely eligible.
evidence: 1. ECF's core focus is on supporting voluntary organisations and charities benefiting people in Essex, as stated: 'we can support a wide range of voluntary organisations, activities and projects across Essex, but we can also give support outside of the county or to specific charities if required.' 2. The vast majority of funds and all example grants are for Essex-based beneficiaries or projects. 3. ellenor Hospice is based in Kent and serves Kent/London boroughs, not Essex. 4. There is no explicit exclusion of hospices or palliative care, and registered charities are eligible, but the geographic scope is a significant barrier. 5. Only in rare cases, at donor request, is support given outside Essex. 6. No open/rolling application status or deadlines are provided. 7. Overall, ellenor Hospice is a low match due to geographic ineligibility, unless a specific fundholder nominates them or a donor has a connection to the charity.
